questions.question_text: Which two characteristics apply to an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Cabled directly inline with the flow of the network traffic
choices.A: Does not add delay to the original traffic
choices.D: Cannot drop the packet on its own
choices.C: Can drop traffic based on a set of rules

discussion.content:
B. Cabled directly inline with the flow of the network traffic
C. Can drop traffic based on a set of rules

questions.question_text: Which quantifiable item should you consider when your organization adopts new technologies?

choices.D: Translation in Section 3 is used when a connection does not match any entries in first two sections.
choices.A: First policy in the Section 1 is dynamic nat entry defined in the object configuration.
choices.B: There are only reverse translation matches for the REAL_SERVER object.
choices.C: NAT policy in Section 2 is a static entry defined in the object configuration.

questions.question_text: In which two situations should you use out-of-band management? (Choose two.)

choices.E: when the control plane fails to respond
choices.C: when management applications need concurrent access to the device
choices.A: when a network device fails to forward packets
choices.D: when you require administrator access from multiple locations

questions.answer_description:
Out-of-band refers to an interface that allows only management protocol traffic to be forwarded or processed. An out-of-band management interface is defined by the network operator to specifically receive network management traffic. The advantage isthat forwarding (or customer) traffic cannot interfere with the management of the router, which significantly reduces the possibility of denial-of-service attacks.
Out-of-band interfaces forward traffic only between out-of-band interfaces or terminate management packets that are destined to the router. In addition, the out-of- band interfaces can participate in dynamic routing protocols. The service provider connects to the routers out-of-band interfaces and builds an independent overlay management network, with all the routing and policy tools that the router can provide.
Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/asr9000/software/asr9k_r4-0/security/configuration/guide/b_sc40asr9kbook/ b_sc40asr9kbook_chapter_0101.pdf

questions.question_text: Referencing the CIA model, in which scenario is a hash-only function most appropriate?
